course_title: Ordinary differential equations and dynamical systems

learning_outcomes.description: Investigate the existence and properties of solutions of systems of ordinary differential equations

Investigate the existence and stability of a stationary point of a system of ordinary differential equations, with reference to Lyapunov Stability, Asymptotic Stability and possibly using Lyapunov functions
Explain what is meant by hyperbolicity and how this implies the existence of stable and unstable manifolds, with reference to Hartman's Theorem and the Stable Manifold Theorem
Investigate the bifurcation properties of critical points in two dimensions and be able to identify saddle node, transcritical, pitchfork and Hopf bifurcations

Investigate the presence, stability characteristics and bifurcation properties of critical points of maps. Investigate bifurcations such as saddle node, transcritical, period doubling and cascades of period doubling bifurcations to chaos
Determine if a map is chaotic, with reference to horseshoes, the property of sensitivity to initial conditions, symbolic dynamics and Lyapunov exponents
Analyse a system of ODEs, from the various methods developed in the course, and communicate your results and findings in writing
Examine how ideas and techniques from this course are applied in other disciplines

Students complete assigned worksheet problems at home and submit written solutions for two selected problems to be marked.
assessments.task_description: Assignments will comprise problems based on material presented in lectures and applied classes. They will include an analytic component and may also include a basic computing component. Students can use Matlab/Octave, Mathematica, Python and/or Julia to complete the computer-based task(s).
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignments will be submitted electronically (as a single pdf file) using Gradescope, by the specified time on the due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 13(02 Mar - 31 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Applied Classes

One applied class a week, in which a casual academic demonstrates solutions of selected problems and is available to answer questions about the applied class sheets. Students work on solving problems and understanding course material, and are able to ask questions.
